alert.note: Alert for Gallatin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 01 at 5:05PM MST until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Montana... Gallatin River at Logan affecting Gallatin County. .An ice jam will cause water to infiltrate the lowlands along the river. For the Gallatin River...including DCP-Gallatin R/Gateway, Logan... elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is occurring. * WHERE...Gallatin River at Logan. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low-lying farm fields, roads, and small bridges adjacent to the river is expected or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM MST Saturday the stage was 8.6 feet and steadily rising. - Forecast...The river is forecast to remain near flood stage of 9.0 feet. Fluctuations of +/- 1 foot are possible. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon at 400 PM MST.
